attributes.action: provide the same level of protection to all members of  the British armed forces that other public sector workers currently receive, to enable them to work and carry out their duties free from threats, abuse, harassment, intimidation. In the case of members of the armed forces the Government must recognise home-coming parades are part of their duties.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Public sector employees are protected by anti-abuse laws covering work-based harassment, abuse, threats and anti-social behaviour. Most workplaces, such as GP surgeries, hospitals, police stations, benefit offices etc display warning signs aimed at perpetrators of such abusive behaviour, that they face prosecution. It is essential that the British public are made aware that while on duty British armed forces should be given the same level of protection - and that includes marching in public. Those who harass, make threats or verbally abuse members of the armed forces who are on duty should face prosecution. Verbal abuse/threats is recognised as a form of violence
